title: Which country will win the UEFA Euro 2020?
possible_answers: The Euro 2020 will be postponed to after July 2021 or canceled
preds: Just basing on bet websites estimations
Risk of bias but if England had to go Rome and the teams were swapped I wouldn't fancy it ... England are stronger, have more depth and are at home.

Reasons to say Engand will win.   
Best unity in the team they've had for a long time (a team rather than 11 individuals).  England have had barely had any travelling to do (essentially a home tournament for them).  Proved their resilince vs Denmark (first true test they've had).  At Wembley and will have 75-80% of the fans there supporting them.   All the players wil be familiar playing there. Reasons to think Italy will win.
They have the better team.  Tough SF vs Spain but have had an extra day to rest.   Less presure on them - it's England's first final since 1966 so they will have that on their minds  -Italy have won the WC in living memory.  They pose more of an attacking threat (more players have scored for Italy than for England in Euro 2020).  Italy have more options from the bench

Italy have not lost a game since September 2018. And this is the first time in 55 years England reaching European Championship final, which admittedly may not be as relevant as one wants it to be.
Italy losing Leonardo Spinazzola to an Achilles rupture is a huge blow to their defense, though.
Despite strong offense for England, I think football won't be coming home just yet. :)
England vs Italy with England being slightly favored.

All of the 15% I had on Spain before the semi final has now gone to Italy / Denmark aka 'Another country'.   But also reduced England from 50% to 45% as they have to win two games to stop Another Country winning.   England still have that realistic chance since it is really a home tournament for them / had little travelling and no suspensions or injuries to disrupt them.    Italy are already in the final and despite it being a tough SF against Spain, have an extra day to recover. The English media are discounting Denmark pretty much, but the England manager should have more sense.
If Denmark doesn't beat England, Italy will.

Italy (65% of my total 75%) vs Denmark (10%). Italy has proven a powerful squad
look at bets as of today, semifinal:
https://www.bettingodds.com/football/european-championship/winner
Having to face reality that England have an outside chance.
Italy V England final seems most likely. My head says that Italy win. My heart says that England win.

I'll be damned, guess it IS coming home after all.
In expected value, the winner of Ita/Spa will have an easier time winning the final, but surely England can swith to its more defensive style again after the semi's.
A whole tournament without conceding? It just might happen.

England vs Denmark, Spain vs Italy. England is a huge favorite against Denmark, Spain Italy is probably pretty even.  England = .8 * .5  = 40%
Spain = .5 * (.5*.8 + .8 * .2) = 28%
Another country = 32%

England have the following advantages ahead of the semi finals.  They had the fortune of playing a weak Ukraine, confidence is up and they didn't have to expend much energy.  Not got any suspensions for the SF.  Denmark played half a world away, a tough match vs the Czechs in Azerbaijan and have hours of flying back to do.  
Italy have the better team, but England have all the advantages now.

4 teams left (FIFA world ranking list):
England (4)  - 30%
Spain (6) - 27%
Italy (7) - 22%
Denmark (10) - 21%

Of 6 teams left, Italy appear strongest having beaten the top ranked Belgium.
There are only 2 of the 6 teams available for selection in the question so even with an even split of odds that is 66%.
Spain wins, but rather unconvincingly. Still they've made the final four teams, so have around a 25% chance.
I think the winner will come from Belgium or Italy, but England will likely be the other finalist now giving them a huge chance
I think England and Belgium have strong possibilities, with one caveat, DeBruyne got injured, if he can not play then the odds for belgium will decrease.

Based off the implied betting odds, England have around a 33% chance, Spain have a 24% chance, and Belgium have a 12% chance. This seems to check out, as England both have a home advantage in the last two matches if they proceed, along with an easier side of the bracket (Denmark/Czech/Ukraine all have lower ELO ratings than Spain/Belgium/Italy). While Belgium has a very talented squad, they have to face Italy (probably a 50/50 game given both teams records so far and in the past few years)  and then either Spain or Switzerland.

I'm not an expert in football , but with Germany and France leaving the competition, i believe that Belgium or Italy will win the UEFA EURO 2020 championship, as both teams have something to prove, but anything is possible in football.

Apart from their next game vs Sweden or Ukraine this would be a home tournament for England.  They've had so little travelling compared to others, and will have fan support in the SF and Final.  All the points I had for Germany now go to them.  Theirs to lose

So we´ve got (FIFA world Ranking list numbers) 
Belgium (1)
England (4)
Spain (6)
--------
Italy (7)
Denmark (10)
Switzerland (13)
Czech Republic (40)
and Sweden (18) or Ucraine (24) still in the race. Already kicked out:
France (2)
Portugal (5)
Germany (12)
and 4 others in FIFA´s top 20 in the world. How likely is it, that one of those 5 "another country" will win? I might be wrong in the end, because this is about probabilities. The consensus went up from 20 to 29 in the past 24 hours, but is that really enough? I don´t think so.
Redone, avg'ing out "current" with expected wins in next round for Cze,Spain and eng/ger
France out, big contenders gaining on this, especially spain (who are through) and "others", with Cze/Den >> Swi

France out so sharing their % out.  Biggest beneficiaries are Spain who France would have played in QF
From 'another country' there are 4 already in last 8, plus one more to come from Swe-Ukr match. At least one will be in semi finals.  Italy also favourites to beat injury hit Belgians.
Whoever wins the Eng-Germany game have a very good chance of reaching the final.  But it will be tough to call that winner now
Whatever happens tomorrow: there will be five teams "another country" out of 8 teams remaining after it. Belgium, Spain and England or Germany on the other side.
Italy, Germany, Belgium. "Other" higher due to other countries that may surprise us (Switzerland, Czech, Denmark)

This is a strange tournament. Switzerland, Czech. Rep, Denmark in, France, Portugal and Netherlands out.
I still cannot bring myself to put England as winners despite my predictor giving them 8%. 
Italy are not slight favourites based on what I've seen and the % chances I give them in each game. A minor edge against Belgium & Spain to get to the final.
Little adjustment for Belgium and Spain while "Denmark, Italy and Czech Republic" from "Another country" are already among the last 8.
Looks, like Spain will win against Croatia as expected. Will do the adjustment for that, when we have certainty about the last 8 teams remaining.

Netherlands and Portugal are out, moving prob away from "another" and (mostly) to Belgium and (to a lesser extent) France.
I'm now gonna already give my best gues for the outcome of today's and tomorrows games and average those with what i see right now to get a more subjective forecast.
This doesn't change much as Fra/Spa are expected by my model to win their game anyway with 80% and 73% prob resp. For Germany (expected win vs england) the impact is quite substantial.

Belgium through to the last 8.  But injuries and yellow cards starting to mount so they get only a slight increase in % - and they face Italy next.
The Netherlands out, so that diminishes chance that winner comes from the 'another country' bin.
Denmark and Czechs are both good teams, but draw possibly opening up for whoever wins the England - Germany tie (so between them they collect the rest of the % given up by Portugal this evening).

First game today over. We´ve got certainty about 3 teams out of 8 in the quarter finals now. Denmark, Italy and Czech Republic. Later this day another one will be added: Belgium or Portugal. Holding for now, although I would have expected Netherlands to win.
No change after yesterday´s games. Everything went as expected. Denmark and Italy as the strongest teams in "Another country" in the next round.

Now we are in the knockout phases I have modelled the possible routes for each team. At present, I have left several of the tighter games in later rounds at 50/50 or close to it (e.g. Belgium v Italy; Belgium v France; Italy v France) and will re-evaluate once the previous rounds are completed and there is a clearer view of injuries, form etc. in knockout games.
I have tweaked the final outcome, specifically England set to zero. I do not believe they will win, despite the model showing 7%, but I am not sure when the 'hope' (that kills you) will be replaced with resignation and disappointment.
This is made slightly more difficult by Italy and to a lesser extent Netherlands being in the Another Country box as. 
The other issue is one side of the draw is BRUTAL - Belgium's likely route is: Portugal, Italy, France, Netherlands (and that ignores Spain & WC finalists Croatia who are meet France in the 1/4 finals!). A few fun outcomes:
Most Likely Final: Belgium vs. Netherlands (400 times more likely than...)
Least Likely Final: Austria vs. Czech Rep. (0.02%)

- Last bin: 
simply zero.
- "Another country": 
10 countries, all but two among top 20 on FIFA´s world ranking list (as of April 2021), two of them better than Germany (12): Italy (7) and Denmark (10), two others close by (Switzerland (13) and Croatia (14)
conclusion: 3* the number for Germany plus "a little more" (always remember: this is soccer, the better team does NOT always win)
- Rest according to ranking in FIFA list: Belgium (1), France (2), England (4), Portugal (5), Spain (6), Germany (12) Key games next round:
- Belgium vs. Portugal
- England vs. Germany
- France vs. Switzerland
- Spain vs. Croatia

https://www.bild.de/sport/fussball/europameisterschaft/em-2021-das-ist-die-aktuelle-fifa-weltrangliste-76052924.bild.html

Revising based on latest odds (with a couple small tweaks on the margin, like slightly lowering england probability as I think the odds probably have a lot of inflows from England): https://www.oddschecker.com/football/euro-2020/winner

I built a quick model, roughly based on plus/minus (Gelade, Hvattum), to give each team a strength indicator.
For me Italy is the best team, France has the best players.
Not far behind is a clutch of countries (Ger/Spa/Bel/Por).
Netherlands and England are best of the rest, the 8 other teams I don't really have a strong opinion on but in Expected value, at least one of them would make it to the last four, with Wales/Denmark favoured for this as they play eachother. I callibrated my model a little to fit my own view on individual game probabilities.
It gave me 85% for Italy > Aus, 80% for Fra > Swi and 73% for Spa > Cro, which all look good to me...but this also means that at least one of them will drop out at the first hurddle with a 50% probability. The "another country" contains Italy and Netherlands so should definitely be the largest at this stage.

Copying from Smitch15 who got there with a good round up up to the final, before I did !! 45 - Croatia or Spain vs. France or Switzerland (Saint Petersburg; noon ET, 6 p.m. CET)       Spain playing their way into form but France for me into SF
46 - Wales or Denmark vs. Netherlands or Czech Republic (Munich; 3 p.m. ET, 9 p.m. CET)     All these are from 'Another country' Winner of 45 faces winner of 46 for one spot in the finals. 47 - Italy or Austria vs. Belgium or Portugal (Baku; noon ET, 6 p.m. CET)     - Several of the favoured teams here (three of the original choices - I expect Portugal and Belgium to leave themselves tired ahead of the likely Italy QF.  Therefore advantage Italy and into SF)
48 - England or Germany vs. Sweden or Ukraine (Rome; 3 p.m. ET, 9 p.m. CET) - Got to fancy whoever wins England-Germany to get to SF, which will be in London

Updating my forecast after the group stages.  A preview of the matches to come.  45 - Croatia or Spain vs. France or Switzerland (Saint Petersburg; noon ET, 6 p.m. CET) - ESPN
46 - Wales or Denmark vs. Netherlands or Czech Republic (Munich; 3 p.m. ET, 9 p.m. CET) - ESPN Winner of 45 faces winner of 46 for one spot in the finals. 47 - Italy or Austria vs. Belgium or Portugal (Baku; noon ET, 6 p.m. CET) - ESPN
48 - England or Germany vs. Sweden or Ukraine (Rome; 3 p.m. ET, 9 p.m. CET) - ABC Winner of 47 faces winner of 48 for the other spot.  I think this leaves the teams most benefited by this schedule are Netherlands (who face no top teams until the final 4), France (easy first round match up), Italy (easy first round match up). Other teams have rough goes (England and Germany in round 1), (Belgium and Portugal in round 1), and (Spain vs Croatia in round 1).  Adding some points to another country as Netherlands and Italy seem to have easyish paths, Belgium (performed great in the groups) and France (easy first round). Subtracting a bit from everyone else.

With Belgium finishing 1st, the probability of making it to the final drops by a lot in my book, as they stay in the tougher half of the table (italy, and at least first and quite possible third placed team in group F)
This is good for denmark, who have a somewhat easier path to the final now.
Adjusted teams in form, winner should be one of Italy, Germany or France.

1. Italy, France (30%)
2. Belgium, Germany (10%)
3. Netherlands, others (10%)

England and spain lower (can't seem to score goals, though spain more unlucky), italy defintely up
italy in table half with 2 of group of death, if belgium wins tomorrow (which seems likely) then "laughing second" in group of death (france? germany?) has an easy ride to the final

(current performance) #1 Italy
#2 Netherlands
#3 Germany
#4 France
#5 Belgium

So only 3 teams won their first two games - Belgium, The Netherlands and Italy.   Funnily enough the last two are in the 'other country' bucket.   So I'm upping the % for these buckets - they can rest players who are tired/on yellow cards in their last group games. 
Spain and England haven't looked good so far - Harry Kane that England depend upon looks tired/uninterested - bringing the % down for those 2.  Now that we're over a week into tournament, time to reduce the chance that it will be cancelled. 
France will qualify for L16  but their draw today could mean Germany finish top of the group
Based on betting odds and performance in MD1 and MD2. Another country == Italy.

6 points/6 for both Belguim and Italy.   Both look good and can rest players if they want for last group game.   Belguim showed that even playing at an away game (Denmark) that they will be difficult to stop
ESP adjusted Form of ITALY and remove probability of teams that are overrated (Portugal and Belgium)

1. Italy, France
2. Belgium, Portugal
3. Netherlands, England
France looked ominously comfortable against Germany last night.

Nothing much happened in the first phase of games to change things from my opening assigned percentages.  Slightly up for Portugal and Belguim for their 3-0 wins, whilst a bit lower for Spain and Germany from their opening games (neither won).  Germany look as if they cannot afford to look the second game against Portugal otherwise they may struggle to be a third place team who qualify.
Main diff to crowd is I think the probability of "another country" is being underweighed, particularly Netherlands and Italy.
Italy should probably be on the list - hence high score for other.

I have adjusted my prediction to lower Spain's chances, as having properly looked at their squad it is far weaker on paper than the other team's. I have boosted the chances of 'Another Country' predominantly due to Italy's strong recent form and rejuvenated starting XI, and have lowered Portugal's chances slightly to accomodate Belgium's strong lineup and ominous form. France remains the clear favourite due to its unsurpassed squad depth and talent of its starting XI.
Tweaked another country up slightly due to Italy’s strength and Netherlands

Difficult to come up with an initial forecast because the warm up games seem a poor indicator, so I'll be updating after some of the group games have been played. My favourites going into the tournament are France (most of the key players in their 2018 world cup winning squad are still playing and performing well), Portugal (very strong with depth and quality in all positions), and England (current squad seems to be a big improvement on the 2018 one, although it does skew young). Belgium also have a good chance but the squad is ageing and KDB's facial injury is a particular concern.  Crucially, I wouldn't risk ignoring the 'Another Country' option. Italy are serious contenders & the Euros is very much a competition with surprises - Greece in 2004 for example.
France or Belgium due to strength of squads
Many of my friends are football fans.  I am more into ice hockey.

Difficult to be too analytical at this stage without simulating every group game, and the dynamic of 3rd place means the final games will take on different significance. For example, there is a suggestion England are better off not winning their group because they are likely to face the runners up in the "group of death" so... As such, this is more on feel. As a pessimistic (some some realistic) England fan, I do not believe they will win the tournament so put them at 0% which may come back to hurt me later. Happy to take the hit on my score if we win.
Surprised Italy are not included as a discrete option.

I can't be bothered to run the permutations on this ridiculous post-groupgame shedule.
Italy should have been in this list.
Dark horses Cze/Den/Wal Most impressed by Fra/Por/Eng and Bel so 60% for those teams

Some basic rational. I have England as high as I do purely because so many games are played at Wembley. France have good recent pedigree, Italy and particularly Germany turn up at tournaments. Belgium and Portugal have some top players but maybe lack depth
France WC winners 2018 and EURO 2016 finalists. 10% for other largely due to omission of Italy who have significant chance of winning (7-9%?)
France imo should be higher, world cup holders and euro finalists last time out. At least as strong a squad, tough group yes ... but still think 23 is low.
History and recent form, along with talent on hand
Basically the betting odds but with a shifted weight away from the books for Brazil
Crowd seems to underestimate the “another country” category.
England hosts, italy in with a good chance (other) other is a big set. Chance of cancellation considerably higher than normal

I have put France as slight favourites due to unrivalled talent of their starting 11 and their unrivalled squad depth. Portugal are next favourites due to their extremely powerful starting line up. I believe they are being strongly underrated. The other teams have a roughly equal chance of winning (~10%), as I feel their starting 11's are not as strong.
Busquets (captain SPAIN tested COVID-19 positive) The Portuguese team which recently had a frienly match against the Spanish team, will likely face some restrictions (preliminary quarantine).

My forecasts are based on performance at previous tournaments, FIFA world ranking and the draw/schedule. I have a relative large probability for 'another country' as Italy is not among the list to chose from and history shows UEFA Euro championships have a larger chance of a surprise winner (Denmark 1992, Greece 2004) than FIFA Wold Cup.

I averaged out historical Euro win, euro 2nd place, world cup win, and world cup top 4 performance, along with FIFA world rankings. A big uncertainty for me is how meaningful the world rankings are. Much of my historical performance data is about decades ago, so my predictions are assuming a lot of continuity of performance over decades. But if I were to just go with the current FIFA world rankings, my predictions would be different.  On cancellation, it seems so much is in motion and the date is so close that it won't get cancelled.

Negatives / positives
Belgium - ageing team but should win group and easy last 16 game
France - the best team and squad out there.  But are in a tough group and have to play in Germany.  Stil expect them to win group and have favourable route to SF
Germany - In a tough group but games are at home, and I expect them to finish runners up or be pipped by Portugal.  But runners up likely to play England in L16 at Wembley
Italy - should comfortably win their group with home advantage.  Last 16 straightforward, but probably face Belgium in QF
Portugal - In tough group F and will do well to get out of the group.  But following Euro win, can't be entirely ruled out even though today's team not as good as then.
Spain - Should comfortably win group given home advantage (strange that so many big teams have home advantage - you'd think UEFA are helping them get through!).  Last 16 a gimme and then the likely QF vs England on neutral Rome could be the tie of that round.
Another country - three stand out amongst the rest.  WC finalists Croatia likely to finish second in group and then play group E runners up in last 16.   But Netherlands is best of the rest, win their group and then no avoid group winners until the semi finals.  Good chance even despite VdV absence.  Italy - should comfortably win their group with home advantage.  Last 16 straightforward, but probably face Belgium in QF
Postponed - unlikely.  There may be a covid flare up in one host nation but UEFA will have contingency to play games elsewhere.

Odds from here: https://www.oddschecker.com/football/euro-2020/winner France - 18
England - 16
Belgium - 14
Spain - 12
Germany - 11
Portugal - 10
Other countries - 19 I'll adjust to give a little more to France and Germany who are favorites here.

GERMANY (all caps:= likely to advance to Round of Sixteen) Belgium: used to be refered to as a "secret favorite", but I don't think this applies any longer
England: UEFA CL winner, one of the most expensive leagues in Europe, however, travel hazards
France: Mbappé, Giroud and Griezman
Germany: Mueller and Hummels are back in the team, Kroos (COVID-19) and Goretzka (injured) are below potential, last tournament for coach Joachim Loew who will quit
Portugal: Ronaldo
Spain: lost dominance, Ramos missing
Another country potentials: Lewandowski (Poland), Ibrahimovic missing (Sweden), Russia (former "secret favorite"), Netherlands, Croatia, Italy (playing in Roma at home in the first round)

England being really over hyped without a world class CB. Can never write off Germans but do seem disunited and in transition. France for me, euro finalists in 16, world cup winners in 18 and squad is in peak. Now or never for Belgium, just doesn't seem to click. Portugal have world class players in defence and attack, Ronaldo ageing, but still does a job!
